pages.text: A winged angel, neither male nor female, with the sign of the sun upon their forehead.$(br)  They are seen pouring the essences of life from chalice to chalice.$(br)  They have one foot upon the earth and one upon waters, thus illustrating the nature of the essences.$(br)  Hereof is some part of the Secret of Eternal Life, as it is possible to humanity in their incarnation.$(br)  The changes in the seasons, perpetual movement of life and

even the combination of ideas can be seen represented.$(br)  It is called Temperance, because, when the rule of it obtains in our consciousness, it tempers, combines and harmonises the psychic and material natures.$(br)  Under that rule we know in our rational part something of whence we came and whither we are going.

$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Traditional temperance: calmness, self-possession, containment.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Delirium. Excess.$(br)  Losing all awareness of self through extreme action or emotion.
